Basic details: Ethan Brown, an 8-month-old boy, is brought to the ED by his parents due to a high fever.
Vitals:
Temp: 102.2°F (39°C)
HR: 140/minute
RR: 30/minute
BP: 85/55 mm Hg
Physical presentation: The child is irritable and crying. He appears flushed and is tugging at his right ear. He has a runny nose and a mild cough. If the examinee mentions otoscope, the child should pull away and cry louder.
Challenging question: "Does my baby have an ear infection? Will he need antibiotics?"
